Paragraph: A thin layer ( 40-50 nm ) of PEDOT : PSS was spin - coated onto silicon substrates , and the pristine polymer or the blended thin films were produced by spin - coating on top of the PEDOT : PSS layer.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PEDOT : PSS |
| pristine polymer |
| blended thin films |

Of course! Here are the valid "Material Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PEDOT : PSS |

I removed the following entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name":

* "thin layer" (it is not a material name)
* "spin - coating" (it is not a material name)
* "pristine polymer" (it is not a material name, it is a description of the polymer)
* "blended thin films" (it is not a material name, it is a description of the films)
